resources.string: A nice head shot picture of you
Please allow the permission in Settings to access IMEI
Please allow the permission in Settings to set up database
You cannot visit the same grid back to back
You cannot select the same word to score
This username has already been registered
Initializing database…\n Do not close the application until it has finished…

\

Strategy of my dictionary

  I mainly used the SQLite database for storage and query.\ Besides, I encoded the short words (not longer than 12 letters) to save space.\ It is less than 90% of the size before I encoded them.\ To do this, I created two tables in my database. One is used for storing short words in integer,\ the other is used for storing long words in text.\ The database is created only once when you first open it but it is very time consuming\ (nearly an hour on Kyocera Rise Emulator, but about one minute on Nexus 5X). I also created indexes for the two tables to reduce complexity from O(n) to O(logn).\ When querying if a word exists, I first determine if the word is a short word or a long word.\ Then I query it in the correspondent table.\ I did a test on its performance, which showed that 1000 times of querying takes about 200ms on an emulator,\ about 400ms on my Nexus phone.

People who helped me

Zhongxi Wang (wang.zhongx@husky.neu.edu): Told me how to use the UI codes from UTTT in my own codes.

Description of this demo

  This demo is just to show that I have learned how to use Firebase and that I have tried \ everything related to the network that need to be used in the two-player word game and they worked fine, \ including easily finding and connecting up with another player of the game, connecting to that person and \ send data back and forth quickly between games and saving and getting information contributed \ to a central place on the server.\n I showed these abilities by making a simple chatting application with automatic paring system. \ When a user logs into the application, he needs to enter his username. After that, the system \ will find another user that is also online and pair them. This process requires saving data and getting \ data from the Firebase real time database. After they are connected, they can send message with each \ other just like a normal chatting program. This process requires sending data back and forth. \ And if there is no internet access, the user is not allowed to access this function. \ These are all the functions that need to be used in the two-player word game.

People who helped me

Zhongxi Wang (wang.zhongx@husky.neu.edu): helped me figure out a way to test the demo code offered by TAs.

Select letters from the same tile continuously to form words. \ The current letter must be next to the last one (up/down/diagonal). \ Each letter can be used only once. \ You will be punished if the word you selected is not a word actually. \ If you are having a hard time finding words, do not wait to use hints! \ You have %1$d seconds for this phase.

Select letters from different tiles continuously to form words.\ You can revisit grids, but not back to back. \ The current letter must be next to the last one (up/down/diagonal). \ Score for each letter is higher but punishment is harsher in this phase. \ You cannot use hints in this phase. \ You have %1$d seconds for this phase.
Internet is not available. Please check your network.
Please find a new user to chat with.

\ This game is played just like regular Tic Tac Toe with one difference: to win a tile you have to win a smaller game of Tic Tac Toe inside that tile.\n\ \n\ A tie happens when there are no further moves. In the case of a tie in a small board, that will count as a win for both sides in the larger game.
